author: Pioneer Staff Report
title: Jaxon Boschee drops 44 in Lumberjacks' heartbreaking overtime loss to Moorhead
text:
Jaxon Boschee scored a team-high 44 points for the Bemidji High School boys basketball team, but the visiting Moorhead Spuds still found a way to escape with a win in overtime.
Bemidji Lumberjacks By Pioneer Staff Report January 30, 2025 at 10:56 PM Share Share this article News Reporting News Reporting Based on facts, either observed and verified firsthand by the reporter, or reported and verified from knowledgeable sources. The Trust Project What is this? BEMIDJI — With less than 15 seconds left in overtime, Jaxon Boschee nailed a 3-pointer. The Bemidji High School boys basketball team was within one point of Moorhead at the BHS Gymnasium.
Shortly after the ensuing inbound pass, the Lumberjacks fouled the Spuds and sent the visitors to the free throw line. Moorhead nailed one of its shots at the line for a 83-81 lead, keeping the door open for a game-winning 3-pointer or a 2-point try to tie things up with seconds left.
ADVERTISEMENT
However, the Jacks couldn’t find that final basket. The Spuds escaped with a 83-81 victory over Bemidji Thursday night, completing the regular-season sweep.
Boschee finished with 44 points, followed by Austin Riewer’s 21.
Moorhead 83, Bemidji 81
MHS 30 53 — 83
BHS 32 49 — 81
Moorhead — Battle 35, Dryburgh 16, Zarazua 12, Kromah 7, Mack 5, Feenery 4, Hoff 2, Thielges 2.
Bemidji — Boschee 44, Riewer 21, Brown 8, Huseby 4, Sneide 2, Zellmann 2.
ADVERTISEMENT

author: Jesús Cabrera
title: A Vox le provoca «rubor y vergüenza» que se den 100.000 euros para el concierto de Luis Miguel
text:
A Vox le provoca «rubor y vergüenza» que se den 100.000 euros para el concierto de Luis Miguel
Badanelli ha recordado que el Banco de Alimentos ha recibido este año sólo 50.000 euros
Córdoba Actualizada 12:57
El Ayuntamiento está tramitando un convenio mediante el cual se subvencionará con 100.000 euros el concierto del cantante Luis Miguel en la plaza de toros, que tendrá lugar mañana. Hoy, la portavoz de Vox, Paula Badanelli, ha afirmado que este hecho le causa «rubor y vergüenza» a su grupo municipal tras conocerlo de forma extraoficial, después de que se les negara el acceso al expediente.
Badanelli ha mostrado su extrañeza ante el hecho de que se aporte tal cantidad de dinero a un concierto organizado por un promotor privado del que ya se ha vendido todo el aforo «y ya no se encuentran entradas por menos de 100 euros».
Comparación con otros colectivos
La portavoz de Vox ha comparado estos 100.000 euros con otros convenios que mantiene el Ayuntamiento con distintas entidades sociales, como Anfane, Asaenec, Redmadre o Alzheimer entre otras. Ha explicado que al Banco de Alimentos ha entregado 50.000 euros, 12.000 a la Cruz Blanca y 80.000 a Cáritas, entre otras. «Esto es inmoral», ha añadido.
Esta edil ha detallado también todo lo que el Ayuntamiento puede hacer con esta cantidad de dinero, por lo que ha llegado a la conclusión de que el empresario le ha dicho «no me salen las cuentas o échame un cable».
Desde Vox sospechan que «el expediente no está montado» y por eso no lo han podido consultar. Además, tampoco ven claro que sea un concejal quien lo firme, porque «si tan bueno es para la ciudad, ¿por qué no lo firma el alcalde?» A esto ha añadido que está a la espera de ver «qué técnico justifica la necesidad». Por último, la portavoz de esta formación se ha preguntado por cuánto ha cobrado esta empresa del Ayuntamiento en el último año. En su opinión, la cifra estaría cercana al millón de euros.
Los remanentes
Por otra parte, Badanelli ha explicado que el gobierno municipal ha rechazado la colaboración de Vox en el reparto de los remanentes. Ha explicado que su apoyo a la aprobación de los presupuestos de 2023 estaba condicionado a la negociación de los remanentes, algo que «lamentablemente» no va a suceder.
La portavoz de Vox ha comentado que estas actuaciones se están realizando «de forma desorganizada, deslavazada, sin un hilo conductor» y este dinero «lo reparten en función de quien pueda gastar rápido, y lamentablemente mal, y de quien lo pide».
Por último, Badanelli ha pedido a los cordobeses que «tengan memoria» a la hora de votar porque «lo hemos intentado y se nos ha dado a entender que teniendo mayoría absoluta no necesitan a nadie».

author: Investing.com
title: La OCDE reafirma su pleno compromiso con el acuerdo fiscal global Por Investing.com
text:
La Organización para la Cooperación y el Desarrollo Económicos (OCDE) ha reiterado su firme compromiso para finalizar un acuerdo fiscal global dirigido a las multinacionales altamente rentables. A pesar de enfrentar retrasos y reticencias de algunos países importantes, la jefa de impuestos de la OCDE, Manal Corwin, expresó una fuerte determinación hacia este objetivo durante una rueda de prensa.
Corwin subrayó la resolución colectiva entre los países miembros, afirmando: "Existe un compromiso del 100% entre los miembros para lograrlo". También destacó la gran urgencia por asegurar un acuerdo antes de que finalice el año, señalándolo como su máxima prioridad personal.
El pacto fiscal global, que forma parte de una estrategia más amplia de dos pilares para reformar la fiscalidad corporativa transfronteriza acordada en 2021, ha experimentado retrasos en sus plazos. Los representantes de casi 130 países no lograron finalizar los términos de un tratado internacional para mediados de año como estaba previsto. Este tratado tiene como objetivo principal redistribuir los derechos de imposición sobre grandes empresas digitales estadounidenses como Google (NASDAQ: GOOGL ), Amazon.com (NASDAQ: AMZN ) y Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL ).
El primer pilar del acuerdo busca sustituir los impuestos unilaterales sobre servicios digitales por un marco que permita compartir los derechos de imposición sobre estas empresas. Sin embargo, el futuro del pacto es incierto, ya que Washington ha señalado que países como India, China y Australia aún no han aceptado las propuestas estadounidenses sobre cálculos alternativos de precios de transferencia.
Por otro lado, la implementación del segundo pilar, que introduce una tasa impositiva corporativa mínima del 15% o un gravamen complementario para las multinacionales que declaran beneficios en jurisdicciones de baja imposición, está progresando. El jueves, la OCDE anunció que un grupo de 19 países habían firmado o se habían comprometido a firmar un tratado que permite a los países en desarrollo gravar ciertos pagos intraempresariales salientes que, de otro modo, podrían ser gravados mínimamente o no ser gravados en absoluto.
El compromiso de la OCDE con el pacto fiscal global pone de manifiesto los esfuerzos de la organización por crear un panorama fiscal internacional más equitativo, a pesar de los desafíos y complejidades que implica alcanzar un consenso entre una amplia gama de naciones.
Reuters contribuyó a este artículo.
Este artículo ha sido generado y traducido con el apoyo de AI y revisado por un editor. Para más información, consulte nuestros T&C.
La OCDE reafirma su pleno compromiso con el acuerdo fiscal global

author: time news
title: 23-year-old Man Arrested in Turkey Extradited to Sweden for Attempted Murder and Kidnapping – Aftonbladet Update
text:
23-Year-Old Man Arrested in Turkey and Extradited to Sweden for Attempted Murder and Kidnapping
A 23-year-old man has been arrested in Turkey and is set to be extradited to Sweden in connection with an attempted murder and a kidnapping in Sundsvall earlier this year. According to information obtained by Aftonbladet, the man, who was detained in his absence, will be returning to Sweden to face charges.
The man is suspected of beating and stabbing three boys along with several other people. Two of the boys are said to have traveled to Sundsvall with the intention of carrying out a murder, while the third boy joined them in Sundsvall and was also subjected to a beating. The boys had reportedly planned the murder, but their plans were leaked, leading to their kidnapping and a brutal assault in a forest area.
They were eventually found on a staircase outside a residential building where they sought help and received medical care. The boys survived the attack but sustained serious injuries and had to be sedated and treated.
The attempted murder is believed to be connected to a conflict over the drug trade in Sundsvall between the Foxtrot and Dalen networks. Parts of the beating were filmed and shared on social media, with the video aiming to mock and belittle the Foxtrot network.
The 23-year-old was arrested in his absence in September, suspected of attempted murder and kidnapping. He is also known to have a prior conviction for breaking the Knife Act and minor drug offenses.
According to Aftonbladet’s information, the man will be extradited from Turkey to Sweden on Friday to face the pending charges.

author: TASS
title: Russia's longtime relations with Palestine help release Russians in Gaza, Putin says
text:
MOSCOW, April 17. /TASS/. The return of Russians from captivity in Gaza has been possible thanks to Russia's long-standing relations with the Palestinian people, Russian President Vladimir Putin said at a meeting with Alexander Trufanov, who was released from Gaza in February.
"The fact that you were restored to liberty is the result of Russia’s stable long-standing relations with the Palestinian people, their representatives, and various organizations," Putin said. "I think we should express our gratitude to the leadership, the political wing of Hamas for agreeing to meet us halfway and performing this act, a humanitarian act of releasing you," he added.
"Of course, we will do everything to ensure that such acts are performed as often as possible and all the people who are still in those conditions, in which you have spent so much time - that they are also released," the Russian president emphasized.
"Thank God you are safe and sound, and here. Right now, I’m not going to give any political assessments to the current developments. But everything that has happened to you is a tragedy," he added, addressing Trufanov and his family members.
Gaza-based Palestinian radicals took Alexander Trufanov, his mother Yelena, grandmother Irina Tati and fiancee Sapir Cohen hostage in an attack on southern Israel on October 7, 2023. Alexander’s father Vitaly was killed. Yelena Trufanova, Tati and Cohen were freed in late November and early December 2023, while Alexander Trufanov was released in mid-February 2025.

author: world today news
title: Study shows cannabis as a genotoxic substance with cancer risks
text:
Headline: Study Links Cannabis Use to Genetic Damage and Cancer Risk
Cannabis Use May Endanger Future Generations: New Research Reveals Cellular Damage Risks
Recent findings published in the scientific journal Addiction Biology substantiate a significant concern regarding cannabis use: it may induce cellular damage that heightens the risk of developing highly cancerous tumors. Researchers at The University of Western Australia have classified cannabis as "genotoxic," indicating that it harms a cell’s genetic material, potentially resulting in DNA mutations, accelerated aging, and cancer. Alarmingly, this genetic damage can also be passed down to future generations via compromised reproductive cells, marking a shift in how cannabis use is perceived—transforming it from a personal choice to a public health concern affecting entire lineages.
Understanding the Research: What the Findings Reveal The paper authored by Dr. Stuart Reece and Dr. Garry Hulse delves into the connection between cannabis use, mitochondrial dysfunction, and cancer risks. Mitochondria are vital cellular structures responsible for energy production; they play a crucial role in maintaining cellular health. The authors highlight established research that has long recognized cannabis’s impairment of mitochondrial function. This impairment can lead to chromosomal damage, opening the door to increased cancer rates, accelerated aging, and the potential for birth defects.
Dr. Reece emphasizes the groundbreaking implications of their findings: “The link we’ve described between cannabis use and genotoxicity has far-reaching consequences. This new research shows how genetic damage from cannabis use can be passed down the generations. This should reframe the discussion surrounding cannabis legalization from a personal choice to one that potentially involves multiple subsequent generations.”
A Closer Look at Genotoxicity Genotoxic substances are known for their ability to cause damage to an organism’s genetic information, which may result in mutations that influence cellular function and overall health. This new understanding of cannabis as a genotoxic agent raises critical questions about its safety and the broader consequences of legalization. As cannabis becomes increasingly accepted in social and medicinal contexts, awareness about its potential risks, especially concerning generational health, is crucial.
Key Findings: DNA Damage: Cannabis use is linked to genetic alterations that can affect cellular health and longevity. Trans-generational Impact: Damage to reproductive cells means that cannabis users might indirectly affect their offspring’s health, making this not just a personal issue but a generational one. Increased Cancer Risk: The mitochondrial dysfunction tied to cannabis consumption has clear implications for overall cancer incidence and longevity. Cannabis Legalization: Reevaluating Perspectives The findings of this research prompt a rethink of the cultural and legislative discourse surrounding cannabis. As many regions ease restrictions on cannabis use, the dialogue needs to transition from a focus on individual liberties to a comprehensive assessment of potential public health effects that span generations.
With the legalization of cannabis already underway in numerous areas, this research may inspire calls for greater regulatory oversight and public health advisories akin to those around tobacco and alcohol consumption. Understanding that the repercussions of cannabis use could impact children and grandchildren alike necessitates a profound change in policy discussions.
Implications for Technology and Public Health As cannabis becomes more integrated into societal norms, technology professionals, especially those in health tech, should consider the implications of such findings when developing educational platforms and digital health applications. This research could drive innovations in health monitoring and genetic assessment that educate users about the risks associated with cannabis.
The intersection of cannabis research and technology is an emerging area ripe for exploration. Businesses in health technology could develop apps that provide consumers with personalized insights based on their cannabis use and its potential long-term genetic impact. Such initiatives could foster informed decision-making and public health awareness.
The Path Forward: Engaging in Dialogue The ramifications of this study are far-reaching, inviting not only further academic inquiry but also engagement from policymakers, public health officials, and everyday consumers. As society grapples with the implications of cannabis normalization, dialogue must incorporate new scientific findings and their potential impact on community health and future generations.
We invite readers to share their thoughts and opinions on this pressing issue. How do you think this research might influence public perception of cannabis? Do you believe it should alter current legalization discussions? Your insights may help shape a more informed conversation around cannabis use and its widespread effects.
For further reading, visit the Addiction Biology journal and explore related articles on our website Shorty-News to stay updated on cannabis research and its implications.

author: Michael Karlis
title: San Antonio mayoral hopeful calls fellow council member a 'poverty pimp' during pay debate | San Antonio | San Antonio Current
text: "Poverty pimp" is a derogatory term used to describe people who exploit the vulnerability and suffering of marginalized communities for personal gain. Pelaez's verbal broadside came during a discussing of six charter amendments council approved at the meeting to go before San Antonio voters this fall. Among the most hotly contested were proposals that would provide pay raises to members of council and and expand their terms from two years to four. Currently, council members earn a meager $45,722, while the mayor takes home $61,725. The amendment that will go before voters Nov. 5 would give council members a 42% pay raise, allowing them to earn $70,200 annually. The mayor would receive $87,800. District 2's McKee-Rodriguez, one of the most progressive members of the dais, has been among the vocal proponents for increasing council pay and has spoken about his need to take a part-time job as a public-school math teacher to make ends meet. "I'm 29 years old. People my age are starting families and having children. I cannot comfortably do that right now, and how many other regular working-class people who want to start a family will not run for office because they know that it will not be attainable or sustainable for them?" McKee-Rodriguez said during the meeting. He continued: "We have to think about that, and we can't close doors behind us. I would be willing to ask my constituents for compensation, but I understand that some of my colleagues probably wouldn't do that. But, I would recommend that anyone who's missed 10 to 15 council meetings probably shouldn't anyway." It's unclear who McKee-Rodriguez was referring to in his jab about missed meetings. Even so, it pissed off both District 8's Pelaez and District 6 Councilwoman Melissa Cabello Havrda, who's reportedly mulling a mayoral run of her own. Both Pelaez and Cabello Havrda are attorneys, and both have missed meetings over recent months. "Y'all can make a big issue about lawyers being up here against [the pay raise], but I was not born a lawyer," Cabello Havrda fired back at McKee-Rodriguez. "I was born in Culebra Park on the West Side, and I worked my butt off in restaurants to get my education. Nobody else paid my way. With one side of your mouth, you talk about the need for educational attainment, and with the other, you're knocking the brown girl from the West Side for getting her JD. The community is watching." For his part, Pelaez went on a comedic rant about council members being "the closest thing to royalty in San Antonio." He lambasted McKee-Rodriguez for his "pejorative snark" and perceived ungratefulness for his privileged position on the dais. "We get to park wherever the hell we want," Pelaez said. "All of us get invited to every Spurs game and all the high-ticket concerts. And by the way, those of us up here who talk about regular-ass people and regular folks and being poverty pimps and all that stuff, you'll see them all in the luxury suites and at luxury events and galas, right?" In the end, the motion to ask voters whether to give council members a pay raise passed in an 8-3 vote. Pelaez, Havrda and District 10's Marc Whyte, another attorney, voted against the measure. In social media posts following the meeting, McKee-Rodriguez and District 5's Terri Castillo, another council progressive, didn't appear to be mad about Pelaez's use of the term "poverty pimp." Instead, they took issue with his claim that council member get free Spurs tickets. "[I] need to know who is not inviting me to Spurs games and suites," Castillo tweeted. McKee-Rodriguez tweeted back, "Embarrassing, but I've never been to a Spurs game." McKee-Rodriguez also tweeted later that he was going to post the attendance records for council members to "make a point." Beyond pay raises and longer terms for council, the package of amendments cleared to go to voters includes: - Raising the city manager's pay beyond its current $374,000 cap. - Allowing city employees to participate in local political activities. - Adding a definition of "conflict of interest" to the City Charter. - Revising language in the charter to account for outdated and superseded provisions. [Subscribe to SA Current newsletters.](https://www.sacurrent.com/sanantonio/NewsletterSignup/Page) Follow us: [Apple News](https://apple.news/TiFMu3wPkRj6PC4xS5L36bg)| [Google News](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqKAgKIiJDQklTRXdnTWFnOEtEWE5oWTNWeWNtVnVkQzVqYjIwb0FBUAE?hl=en-US&gl=US&ceid=US%3Aen)| [NewsBreak](https://www.newsbreak.com/@c/1599768?s=01)| [RSS Feed](https://www.sacurrent.com/sanantonio/Syndication)

author: 小浪财讯
title: 央企结构调整ETF（512960）跌1.19%，半日成交额628.23万元|结构调整_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，央企结构调整ETF（512960）跌1.19%，报1.250元，成交额628.23万元。央企结构调整ETF（512960）重仓股方面， 海康威视 截止午盘跌1.12%， 国电南瑞 跌0.31%， 招商银行 跌0.70%， 中国电信 跌0.77%， 长安汽车 跌1.11%， 宝钢股份 跌1.82%， 中芯国际 跌0.23%， 长江电力 跌0.33%， 中国神华 跌0.66%， 中国移动 跌0.21%。
央企结构调整ETF（512960）业绩比较基准为 中证央企结构调整指数 收益率，管理人为博时基金管理有限公司，基金经理为赵云阳，成立（2018-10-19）以来回报为33.71%，近一个月回报为0.48%。
风险提示：市场有风险，投资需谨慎。本文为AI大模型自动发布，任何在本文出现的信息（包括但不限于个股、评论、预测、图表、指标、理论、任何形式的表述等）均只作为参考，不构成个人投资建议。
